Tasks.Task Description: Gather and document the functional and non-functional requirements for the Azure Functions project, including expected load, performance metrics, and integration points.
Choose the appropriate hosting plan for Azure Functions (Consumption Plan, Premium Plan, or App Service Plan) based on the project requirements.
Provision a new Azure Function App in the Azure portal, ensuring to select the correct subscription, resource group, and hosting plan.
Set up application settings, including connection strings, environment variables, and any necessary app settings for the Azure Functions.
Enable security features such as Managed Identity, API Management, and authentication/authorization settings to secure the Azure Functions.
Write the code for the Azure Functions, ensuring to follow best practices for performance and maintainability. Use triggers and bindings as required.
Configure CI/CD pipelines using Azure DevOps or GitHub Actions to automate the deployment of Azure Functions.
Conduct thorough testing of the Azure Functions, including unit tests, integration tests, and performance tests to ensure they meet the defined requirements.
Set up monitoring using Azure Application Insights to track the performance and usage of the Azure Functions. Configure alerts for failures and performance issues.
Create comprehensive documentation for the architecture, configurations, and code of the Azure Functions project. Include operational procedures and troubleshooting guides.
Perform regular security audits to ensure compliance with security best practices and to identify any vulnerabilities in the Azure Functions setup.
